description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Aix-en-Provence" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Aix-en-Provence

sources.shortName: Top things to do in Aix-en-Provence

reviews.text:
Comfy place with very good food. It's very crowded so make a reservation before or go early.
We had duck and beef stew, the duck was perfect. Had a good amount and was delicious, had a savory sauce.
The beef stew was good too, warm meal for a cold night, but had two pieces impossible to eat because  of the fat üò¨
They offer nice complimentary bread with the meal.
The lava cake chocolate is a nice dessert to end the evening, not too sweet, made with bitter chocolate.
They have good wines too. The only problem in the menu, is very hard to read and understand what it's written

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely one of the best meals we've had in Provence! Every dish was beautifully presented, made with fresh ingredients, and cooked to absolute perfection - flavorful, generous portions, and just hit the spot.

Both indoor and outdoor seating were charming - cozy, thoughtfully decorated, and full of character.

But the highlight of our lunch? Yori! He was wonderful - spoke perfect English, incredibly patient and kind, and made us feel genuinely welcomed and well taken care of. His service brought a true sense of warm, authentic hospitality that made our whole experience even more special.

Highly recommended if you're looking for a place that combines great food, lovely ambiance, and heartfelt service.

BEST OF THE BEST.
Thank you for the wonderful service and delicious food!
I had a dinner here with my potential business partner and everything was so wonderful! You can count on this restaurant no matter for business dinner or family time üëèü§çThank you, especially thank the lovely service team , love your smiles and passion.
The food is very good. I recommend.

places.generalDescription: Sauvage is a cozy neighborhood restaurant with an open kitchen where guests can watch the chefs at work. The chef-owner, Loic Petri, and his team offer a unique 9-course menu featuring creative combinations of fresh, carefully selected ingredients that play with temperatures and textures. Dishes like langoustine with wine and citrus, pigeon with roots and Colonnata lard, and lamb brain with eel and sesame showcase the bold yet unpretentious cuisine.

sources.shortName: How to Spend the Perfect One Day in Aix-en-Provence, France: Itinerary, Map, & Tips

places.name: Sauvage

reviews.text:
Rated compared to Michelin guide contenders. Wonderful food. We went for lunch and concluded the meal a highlight of Aix. Fresh ingredients are combined with innovation, but not over the top.  The sauces were superb. And every dish so pretty! All together a fantastic lunch.

The menu is set but we chose to add the scallops,  and we're glad we did, it was delicious. We started with an amuse bouche of lobster and radish that was wonderful, then 3 courses, followed by a light dessert. Every dish was a delight. The wine is interesting,  there is no menu, but a glass or bottle recommended by the waiter from a small but thoughtful cellar.  We were very pleased with the chablis region wine suggested for us.

Highly recommended!

Had an incredible dinner here at Etude. 11 courses, no misses. Every dish was great and cooking was superb. Wine tasting was thoughtful and lovely as well. Chef was super friendly and welcoming. Hope to be back!

We stumbled across this restaurant while walking past and managed to snag a table for lunch with no reservation. We had a 4 course set lunch menu - each course was delicious, full of flavour and the proteins perfectly cooked. Service was efficient and friendly. We really enjoyed our lunch here!

places.address: 24 rue de l Rue Aum√¥ne Vieille, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: L'incontournable is a French restaurant with a small menu, which makes the dishes refined in taste. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the location in the heart of Aix-en-Provence with three bottles of roses in the fountain makes it special.

sources.shortName: 5 Great Places to Visit in Aix-en-Provence

places.name: L'incontournable

reviews.text:
We had an absolutely amazing experience at L'incontournable! From the moment we arrived, the atmosphere was welcoming and elegant, and the staff was incredibly attentive and professional throughout the entire evening.

The food was nothing short of extraordinary. We ordered the sea bass, the lamb, and the daily special, a perfectly cooked salmon and each dish was beautifully presented and full of rich, balanced flavors. The quality of the ingredients and the care put into the preparation were evident in every bite.

We also tried the dessert, which was equally impressive, refined, delicious, and the perfect way to end an exceptional meal.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a top-tier dining experience. We'll definitely be returning!

A very nice restaurant in the heart of Aix-en-Provence, with outdoor seating and beautifully presented French or fusion dishes. The complimentary gazpacho was refreshing and delicious on a hot summer day, and I enjoyed it even as someone who is not a big fan of cold soups. The fish dish had typical Mediterranean flavors, whereas the beef dish was clearly influenced by Japanese cuisine, both very fresh and tasty. The side salad was great as well. Price is a bit higher compared to other restaurants nearby. Service was friendly but a bit slow as they get very busy in the evenings.

Excellence all around.  So happy that we were able to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday here.  The food was so good it begs for many returns.  The staff was professional and very friendly.  If in Aix, this is a must do restaurant

places.address: Place des 3 Ormeaux, 5 Rue des Epinaux, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: Villa Gallici - Relais & Ch√¢teaux is a luxurious hotel located in Aix-en-Provence, France. This Italianate mansion offers an elegant and refined experience for guests. The hotel features a beautiful outdoor pool, lush gardens, and a spacious terrace where visitors can savor the delightful Proven√ßal cuisine by Christophe Gavot.

sources.snippet: A flamboyant hotel surrounded by Florentine gardens, terraces, and large pool. Lavish fabrics and a healthy smattering of bold wallpaper give a over wrought luxurious feel to the suites. The restaurant is one of the best in Aix and always full of locals.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Aix-en-Provence, France (2025)

places.name: Villa Gallici - Relais & Ch√¢teaux

reviews.text: Lovely hotel.  I felt like I was in a beautiful chateau.  The location was great but the best part was the people.  Everyone was very attentive and nice, especially the gentleman that had been there many years (I think 30!). What a wonderful man.  So friendly and happy.  It was a pleasure to say there and I hope to return soon!

We went with my wife to enjoy a relaxing morning at the SPA, the Villa being 5* we had high expectation but what we experienced was truly outstanding!
Camille and Aur√©lie from the SPA welcomed us as if we were VVIP's, took us to to our massage rooms where we both had one of the best massages we've ever had. We were then fortunate to be able to enjoy the pool (normally reserves for hotel guests) to bath in the southern sun.
Needless to say that we left fully relaxed and we wished we could have stayed longer (we had other plans).
If you're looking for a quaint, beautiful and intimate stay located in the hearth of Aix, no need to look any further.

No place better than this in Aix-en-Provence for a luxury experience. The team is extremely warm and professional.
The guest relations manager really makes you feel at home.
The dedicated Concierge desk helps with recommendations, reservations and planning.

places.address: 18 Av. de la Violette, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: C√¥t√© Cour is a fine dining restaurant offering Proven√ßal and Mediterranean cuisine in a modern setting with a leafy courtyard. Chef Ronan Kernen, known for his appearance on Top Chef 2011, creates inventive dishes using the best local ingredients from Aix's markets. The menu features fresh, seasonal dishes such as foie gras, crepes, lamb in a walnut crust, and sea bass fillet.

sources.snippet: Chef Ronan Kernan uses the best ingredients that Aix‚Äôs local markets have to offer for the creative and spirited cuisine found at C√¥t√© Cour. Fresh, seasonable dishes are paired with a large selection of wines in a modern setting, complete with an intimate courtyard. Think: Foie gras, crepes (of course), lamb in a walnut crust, and sea bass fillet.
sources.shortName: How to Plan a Romantic Honeymoon in Aix-en-Provence

places.name: C√¥t√© Cour

reviews.text:
One of our best meals in Aix-en-Provence and better than the sister restaurant we had the day before.

From the appetizers to the dessert everything was spectacular. The flavors are on point and the only thing that can be improved is increasing the number of wait staff during peak season as it was a challenge to get our orders in.

The place looks amazing. If you are sensitive to heat and there in Summer ask for a seat under the shade instead of the glass ceilings.

Their appetizers were amazing. The ceviche was yummy, but the main entree dishes (duck and the steak) were hard to chew and didn't have any flavor. Not worth the price :/ also, the wait was forever for food/bill/etc. they said that they are short staffed, but didn't apologize or ask for understanding ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I went here to celebrate a friend's birthday. They organized the candle and that was much appreciated alongside the service. Food was a 2 star because it has been reviewed really well but it actually was disappointing. Most of the food were overcomplicated and overpowered by unnecessary flavor. We got 3-4 starters, 4 mains. But only one of the mains was decent. The rest were very disappointing. To top this, I actually got a viral gastroenteritis and I think it was because of the tuna steak, which can only explain it was poorly prepared. Although on the night, I only fed back it was too salty, but I realize probably the salt covered the unwanted taste of not fresh fish. Service was decent. Atmosphere was okay, mostly because we've heard twice the kitchen disposing glasses or breaking bottles - unsure, but quite loud noises. For paying more than usual compared to the other restaurants in the area, it's not worth it.

sources.snippet: The best way to get to Aix-en-Provence by car is to take the A7 highway from Lyon or Marseille. From Lyon, it takes about 2.5 hours and from Marseille, it takes about 30 minutes. You can also take the scenic D7 road from Marseille to Aix-en-Provence which takes about 45 minutes.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - Best 20 things to do in Aix-en-Provence, France

places.name: CarJager

reviews.text: I was in my function as the sales manager of Sportec AG Switzerland on research for a customer of ours to find a Porsche 964 Carrera 2 and found the perfect car with CarJager. Away from first contact until delivery of the car to another European Country, the service of CarJager staff was state of the art, anytime transparent, flexible and confidential. We would recommend CarJager @ any time again, thanks Thomas

I am unfortunately not satisfied with my purchase from CarJager. The car had several technical issues that were not disclosed to me, and the repairs cost ‚Ç¨7,600. Had I been better informed about the vehicle's condition, I would have reconsidered my decision to buy it.

I advise future buyers to be extra cautious and thoroughly inspect any vehicle before purchasing.

I bought a 1980 911 3.0 SC Weissach via Car Jager, the car was just as described in the ad and the transaction went super smooth.
Quick feed back to all my questions and most important for me i had a feeling of security during the whole procedure.
Definately recommend them!

places.address: 15 Av. de Lattre de Tassigny, 13090 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: La Rotonde is a vibrant and trendy spot in Aix-en-Provence that perfectly captures the essence of this charming city. Nestled right by the iconic fountain, which dates back to 1860, it serves as both a historical landmark and a lively gathering place. The caf√© boasts an inviting atmosphere with elegant chandeliers and outdoor seating, making it ideal for enjoying Mediterranean cuisine crafted from fresh seasonal ingredients. Guests can indulge in delicious wood-fired pizzas while soaking up the ambiance of this bustling locale.

sources.snippet: La Rotonde sits overlooking the glorious city fountain and has a lively atmosphere, elegant interiors, and outdoor dining (ideal for a romantic date and some people-watching).
sources.shortName: How to Plan a Romantic Honeymoon in Aix-en-Provence

places.name: La Rotonde

reviews.text: We ate here twice while in Aix. Both times the service was impeccable, they adjusted some menu items to accommodate for allergies / preferences and were so friendly. The food was lovely and the restaurant itself was beautiful. The second time we visited our waitress Darya was especially amazing. We said we don't think we've ever had service that good from any restaurant globally! Thanks again Darya especially - she is a real credit to the restaurant

Service was fast. Food was great. We ordered a pot of mussels and it came with bread and a small bucket of fries. The taste. Delicious. It was so good we came back again two days later. If you are on low salt then specify when ordering. Otherwise just enjoy !

It's looks like a tourists place, but not exactly, a lot of locals have lunch and dinner here (reservation for dinner, highly recommended).
Food fresh, menu changes periodically, everything made from scratch.
Service friendly.

places.address: 2 A Pl. Jeanne d'Arc, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: Le Mas D'entremont is a charming hilltop hotel offering quaint rooms with Wi-Fi and private terraces, providing incredible views of Aix. The authentic decor perfectly complements the French countryside setting, making it an ideal escape from city life. The hotel features an outdoor pool, tennis courts, a fitness center, and a bar.

sources.snippet: A rural property set in beautiful gardens boasting open courtyards with shaded seating, old beamed living rooms and a large pool. Bedrooms are light and modern with crisp white linen. A tennis court and gym entertain the active.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Aix-en-Provence, France (2025)

places.name: Le Mas D'entremont

reviews.text: My wife and I loved this place. Rooms are charming and typically Provence. The rooms are cottage style, not modern style.We had a birthday party of 30 people, buffet style in lovely Provence surroundings. The staff and management did us proud.

Very frustrating experience with regards to the service quality at the restaurant. We have booked at hotel restaurant a month ago but when we got there, we understood we have a seat by the pool and it is just a snack menu. We asked a table in the main restaurant but we have been refused although there were lots of empty seats. They need some flexibility. We had a bad quality food, very limited choice and inflexible waiters in our minds now. It is a pity. The design of the rooms and external areas are amazing. Unfortunately people change your experience‚Ä¶

We stayed here one night as we did a little road trip through the south of France. The hotel itself is rustic and charming and from what the front desk shared, has been within the family for generations. We had a wonderful stay here. The grounds were beautiful and looked perfect for an intimate wedding or such. The front desk staff was so welcoming and made sure we were well taken care of and we appreciated their kindness very much. I would recommend and would come back again!

places.generalDescription: Les Jardins d'Albertas is a breathtaking botanical paradise that will leave you in awe. The meticulously manicured hedges and picturesque landscapes create an enchanting atmosphere, making it feel like a scene from a romantic comedy. This verdant haven hosts various events such as 'Journee des Plantes,' attracting plant enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. Despite its size, the garden's charm and abundance of greenery make it a fantastic place for relaxation.

sources.snippet: Welcome to Jardin d'Albertas, the French equivalent of a botanical wonderland on steroids!. Prepare to be awestruck by the enchanting symphony of meticulously manicured hedges, as if the plants themselves went to art school and aced every class. This verdant paradise is so picturesque, you'll feel like you've entered an over-the-top romantic comedy set, with the flowers playing matchmaker to bees and butterflies.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - Best 20 things to do in Aix-en-Provence, France

places.name: Les Jardins d'Albertas

reviews.text: We never heard of this site before reading an article in a national newspaper and my parents live nearby. We came here a day before a music festival and noone was at the gate. We met an organizer of ghe festival who explained about the festival and then we wandered freely in the park. It was a real surprise to find such a lovely park with statues and a fountain. A great place to attend a concert and a nice place to visit when in the area.

It is a beautiful and well-maintained garden with very peaceful atmosphere. Really recommend for an hour of quite and calm time. However, it's very small and there are no facilities there (no cafe or shop, just a toilet). I don't think it's worth ‚Ç¨5 per person.
A fantastic place for rest and relaxation.  Although the place is not large, it charms with its charm.  A lot of green.  I recommend

sources.snippet: There is no direct way to get to Aix-en-Provence by boat as it is an inland city. However, you can take a boat tour from Marseille or Cassis which will take you to various coastal locations near Aix-en-Provence. From there, you can take a shuttle or train into Aix-en-Provence.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - Best 20 things to do in Aix-en-Provence, France

places.name: Boat License Aix En Provence - Marseille : Attou'navigation

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Thanks to Fares for this very interesting theoretical day, theory obtained the following week! Very good atmosphere. No waiting times, permit obtained in 3 weeks! Attractive and reasonable price.
I advise you, with my eyes closed.

(Original)
Merci √† Fares pour cette journ√©e th√©orique tr√®s int√©ressante, th√©orie obtenue la semaine suivante ! Tr√®s bonne ambiance. Aucun d√©lais d'attente, permis obtenu en 3 semaines ! Tarif attractif et raisonnable.
Je vous le conseil, les yeux ferm√©s.

(Translated by Google) I just got my boat license and I recommend this school without hesitation!
The team is excellent: educational, professional, and always attentive. The training is clear, well-structured, and the support right up to the exam is truly reassuring.
Thank you for your professionalism and good humor; it was a great experience!

(Original)
Je viens d'obtenir mon permis bateau et je recommande cette √©cole les yeux ferm√©s !
L'√©quipe est au top : p√©dagogue, professionnelle et toujours √† l'√©coute. La formation est claire, bien encadr√©e, et l'accompagnement jusqu'√† l'examen est vraiment rassurant.
Merci pour votre s√©rieux et votre bonne humeur, c'√©tait une super exp√©rience !

(Translated by Google) A big thank you to Fares, thanks to whom I was able to obtain my boat license quickly! I highly recommend Attounavigation: an excellent driving school that takes the time to explain each step to you thoroughly, with seriousness and pedagogy. If you are looking for quality training and top-notch support to obtain your license, don't hesitate!

(Original)
Un grand merci √† Fares gr√¢ce √† qui j'ai pu obtenir mon permis bateau rapidement ! Je recommande vivement Attounavigation : une excellente auto-√©cole qui prend le temps de bien vous expliquer chaque √©tape, avec s√©rieux et p√©dagogie. Si vous cherchez une formation de qualit√© et un accompagnement au top pour obtenir votre permis, n'h√©sitez pas !

places.generalDescription: Les Vieilles Canailles is a cozy wine bar with a passionate chef who sources the best local ingredients for dishes like roasted octopus salad and succulent lamb. The wine selection focuses on small natural and biodynamic producers from all over France. The menu changes frequently based on seasons, weather, and daily catches. The bistro offers traditional French cuisine in a warm and welcoming atmosphere, where the team takes pleasure in describing each dish in detail.

sources.shortName: How to Spend the Perfect One Day in Aix-en-Provence, France: Itinerary, Map, & Tips

places.name: Les Vieilles Canailles

reviews.text:
What an amazing find.
We read about this in Le Fooding, and it did not disappoint.
7.30 sharp seating, fabulous theatre from Frederico, who really knew the wines and dishes, starting a bi-lingual detailed description. Amazing food, very different wines with each course, and despite being out by 9.30 for a second service we did not feel rushed at any stage. Definitely one to go to!

An absolute highlight of our visit to Aix. A tiny spot and a French owner with a huge personality and fantastic taste in wines. From the bone marrow to the mains (paired with Domaine Overnoy's Savagnin 2022) to the French dessert cheese and Paris Brest (paired with the incredible Les Grains des Compains Jurancon 2022), the food was all beautifully done. Definitely reserve in advance as there are only two seatings per evening- probably the earlier one as we ran over as well. Don't miss this gem!

We fully enjoyed the dinning experience - an intimate, energetic and positive vibe!

The owner introduced what they had for the night and we chose two entrees,two main courses, and a dessert. Before the meal, he let us know what wines he had to pair with the dinner and he also has a very wide range of other wines you can choose from.

The dinner has two sections - one at 7:30 and another at 9:30. There are only about 20 seats so it's best to book ahead of time.

Ouf of the courses we ordered, we love the beef tongue main course the most - it's a creative way to pair the beef tongue with olive, mushroom and cucumber. They blended perfectly.

The owner, I think he's name is Frank, was super passionate about food and wine. We absolutely love his energy!
